conclusion: To determine the car's speed at the end of the 2nd second, we need to analyze the given x-t (position-time) graph.
The x-axis represents time (t) in seconds, and the y-axis represents position (x) in meters. The graph shows a straight line, indicating constant velocity.
The slope of the x-t graph represents the velocity of the car.
The slope (m) can be calculated using the formula: m = Δx/Δt.
From the graph, the line passes through the points (0, 10) and (-2, 0).
Using the points (0, 10) and (-2, 0), the slope m = (10 - 0) / (0 - (-2)) = 10/2 = 5 m/s.
Since the slope is constant, the velocity of the car is constant at 5 m/s.
The speed at any time, including the end of the 2nd second, is the same as the velocity because the car is moving at a constant speed.
The car's speed at the end of the 2nd second is 5 m/s.
